result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon A. Goodell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Psychological evaluations and any recommendations per agent

Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  Sex offender registration/treatment per agent. Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription and must notify agent w/in 48 hours if one is received.  Absolute Sobriety of alcohol.  No contact w/children under 18 years of age unless previously approved by agent.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Sentencing Hearing 3/21/18

Defendant Brandon A. Goodell in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case.  ADA Hoffman states appearance for State.  Atty. Masana states DE and atty. appearance. Atty. Masana clears up cases that Court had questions on (Sauk & Adams Co. cases).  State recv'd recovation summary.  Defense recv'd revocation summary.  State gives recommendation of 6 yrs IC/6 yrs. ES  and some history of DE.  Atty. Masana gives recommendation - ALJ gave DE probation 8 years in Adams Co. case.  Atty. Masana requests 3 yrs. IC/2 yrs. ES consecutive to Adams Co..  Court imposes sentence.  Court does felony admonishment.

Count 1:
WI State Prison for 8 years (4 years Initial Confinement/4 years Extended Supervision)  
786 days credit
Undergo any counseling per agent to include SOT and registry and any other treatment 
Obtain/Seek/Maintain full time employment
Undergo any psychological evaluation per agent
No possession of controlled substances w/o valid Rx
No contact w/children under the age of 18 unless approval by agent
Absolute Sobriety
No contact w/TRO
Any unpaid costs to be civil judgment
Not Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program 
Not Eligible for Substance Abuse Program
Paperwork handed in court.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 21, 2018 at 02:15 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 26, 2018 at 10:00 am.
NOH of SEHR
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 25, 2018 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Brandon A. Goodell in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Defendant Brandon A. Goodell in custody.  Linda Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Masana request bond modification.  Delay due to PSI.  Cash bonded is what is holding defendant.  14CF371 bond is $1000 and 14CF274 bond is $5000.00.  Attorney Masana request modification if the cash bond.  State objects to any bond modifications.  Attorney Masana addresses age of defendant.  No flight risk.  Would have residency with his mother.  Would like to seek employment.  Court agrees matter should have been resolved by now, however denies motion to modify bond in either case.
Motion hearing at 05-18-2015 03:00 pm
for bond modification
Sentencing hearing at 07-13-2015 01:30 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 6, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Brandon A. Goodell in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Defendant Brandon A. Goodell in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Masana states all matters are resolved and states agreement.  PSI to be requested w/parties free to argue at sentencing but the State agrees to not recommend a prison sentence.  State is in agreement.  Atty Masana enters NC pleas to Ct 1 in 14CF274 and Ct 1 in 14CF317.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds guilty.  State explains to court that not all victims had notice as two of the cases were not on her calendar for today.  Recess for State to see if victim is available.  Back on the record the State notes they were unable to get ahold of the victim in 14CF274.  They will email the victim and notice her of the SEH so the DE can get started on the PSI.  Court will proceed today.  PSI is ordered.  To be completed not later than 4/30/2015.

Defendant Brandon A. Goodell by video from LEC with attorney Stanley V. Woodard.  Defendant Brandon A. Goodell in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives reading of complaint.  State requests $10,000 cash bond w/conditions.  Atty Woodard responds.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $5,000.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute sobriety at all times from drugs and alcohol, not to leave the State of Wisconsin w/o court approval and no contact w/any child under 18 years of age.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 15, 2014 at 09:15 am.  Return date scheduled for September 4, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
